title: Parrotfish
summary: Parrotfishes are a group of about 90 fish species  regarded as a family (Scaridae), or a subfamily (Scarinae) of the wrasses.[1] With about 95 species, this group's largest species richness is in the Indo-Pacific. They are found in coral reefs, rocky coasts, and seagrass beds, and can play a significant role in bioerosion.[2][3][4]
